law.catch_line: Lien for service fee of stallion, jack, or bull -- Enforcement of lien.

text.section: Any licensed keeper of a stallion, jack, or bull shall have a lien for the payment of the service fee upon the get of the stallion, jack, or bull, for one (1) year after the birth of the progeny. However, a lien created pursuant to KRS 376.400 shall take priority over a lien created pursuant to this subsection.
This lien may be enforced by action as in cases of other liens, or by warrant as permitted in the case of the enforcement of the lien of the keeper of a livery stable or an agister.

law.history: Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 28, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1996. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 2503, 2504.
